column2: TINDAKMALAYSIA NETWORK SERVICES PLT (TINDAK MALAYSIA)

Local Authority General Elections 1963 and also General Elections to Local Councils in Trengganu in 1963: Results and Statistics of Voting. Refer to 1963_MALAYA_LOCAL_GOVERNMENT_ELECTION_OTHER_SOURCES

Candidate spellings follow EC spelling standards. There are gaps for candidate age and sex category.  No data available for the component parties for the Socialist Front. In the case of two-member wards, a ballot paper may be used to record two votes. In the case of three-member wards, a ballot paper may be used to record three votes. No Total Ballot Issued values for multi-member wards as no information on unique ballot count was provided. No Information on the type of electoral roll used for the 1963 Malayan Local Government Elections. Turnout level values reflect EC's reporting. The file of Election Details is a combination of EC reported information, The Straits Times and other sources. Voting Electorate refers to electorate size of contested wards. The areas of ten local councils of Trengganu (that were used for 1962 local elections) were deemed too big for effectiveness and efficiency of local government administration. Out of 10 local councils, seven were re-established (Kuala Trengganu Utara, Kuala Trengganu Barat, Kuala Trengganu Selatan, Paka, Kemaman, Besut). Candidate of Darat Makbar Timor Ward (Kuantan) association with MIC is guessed. The name of MCA Candidate of Temiang Atas Ward (Seremban) is not very clear. Candidates of Rim Ward (Jasin) association with MIC is guessed. The UDP candidate of Ujong Pasir Ward (Municipality of Town and Fort of Malacca) was former UMNO member who contested as protest of UMNO's fielding of J.L. D'Cruz (who is UMNO associate member). TindakMalaysia Network Services PLT is not responsible for any errors or omissions arising from the original data or its derivatives.

EC report claims the total Alliance vote is 48895, Tindak compilation states is 48893

Trengganu
EC report claims the total Alliance vote is 9677 (Local Authority Areas), Tindak compilation states is 9740 (Local Authority Areas)
EC report claims the total ballot issued is 20435 (Local Authority Areas), Tindak compilation states is 20422 (Local Authority Areas)
EC report claims the total elector count is 29809 (Local Authority Areas), Tindak compilation states is 29787 (Local Authority Areas)
EC report claims the total PMIP vote is 6602 (Local Council Areas), Tindak compilation states is 6734 (Local Council Areas)
EC report claims the total Negara vote is 5617 (Local Council Areas), Tindak compilation states is 5385 (Local Council Areas)
According to Straits Times 4/8/1963, for local councils, there were 22 PMIP candidates and 22 Negara Candidates (though evidence is lacking for such numbers)
